title: Google\Cloud\VMMigration\V1\CreateDatacenterConnectorRequest
name: CreateDatacenterConnectorRequest
description:
Request message for 'CreateDatacenterConnector' request.

Generated from protobuf message google.cloud.vmmigration.v1.CreateDatacenterConnectorRequest

Extends Google\Protobuf\Internal\Message

params.name: data
params.description: Optional. Data for populating the Message object.

params.name: data.parent
params.description: Required. The DatacenterConnector's parent. Required. The Source in where the new DatacenterConnector will be created. For example: projects/my-project/locations/us-central1/sources/my-source

params.name: data.request_id
params.description: A request ID to identify requests. Specify a unique request ID so that if you must retry your request, the server will know to ignore the request if it has already been completed. The server will guarantee that for at least 60 minutes since the first request. For example, consider a situation where you make an initial request and t he request times out. If you make the request again with the same request ID, the server can check if original operation with the same request ID was received, and if so, will ignore the second request. This prevents clients from accidentally creating duplicate commitments. The request ID must be a valid UUID with the exception that zero UUID is not supported (00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000).

methods.name: getRequestId
methods.description:
A request ID to identify requests. Specify a unique request ID so that if you must retry your request, the server will know to ignore the request if it has already been completed. The server will guarantee that for at least 60 minutes since the first request.

For example, consider a situation where you make an initial request and t he request times out. If you make the request again with the same request ID, the server can check if original operation with the same request ID was received, and if so, will ignore the second request. This prevents clients from accidentally creating duplicate commitments. The request ID must be a valid UUID with the exception that zero UUID is not supported (00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000).

Generated from protobuf field string request_id = 4;
